description: You only need 7 ingredients to make this simple sandwich bread. Soft and buttery with a chewy/crisp crust, this fresh loaf of bread will quickly become a staple in your kitchen.
ingredients: [{"name": "water", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "whole milk", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "Platinum Yeast from Red Star instant yeast", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "2 and 1/4"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "1 and 1/2"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour or bread flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "3 and 1/3"}]
instructions: 1. Prepare the dough: Whisk the warm water, warm milk, yeast, and sugar together in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment. Cover and allow to sit for 5 minutes. 2. Add the butter, salt, and 1 cup flour. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, then add another cup of flour. Beat on medium speed until relatively incorporated. Add the remaining flour and beat on medium speed until the dough comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 2 minutes. 3. Knead the dough: Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5–8 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5–8 full minutes. 4. 1st Rise: Lightly grease a large bowl with olive oil or nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl and allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment for 1-2 hours or until double in size. 5. Shape the bread: When the dough is ready, punch it down to release the air. Lightly flour a work surface, your hands, and a rolling pin. Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 8×15 inches. Roll it up into an 8 inch log and place in the prepared loaf pan. 6. 2nd Rise: Cover shaped loaf and allow to rise until it’s about 1 inch above the top of the loaf pan, about 1 hour. 7. Bake the bread: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Bake for 32-36 minutes or until golden brown on top. Remove from the oven and allow bread to cool for a few minutes in the pan on a cooling rack before removing the bread from the pan and slicing.
notes: You can freeze the shaped loaf for up to 3 months. On the day you serve it, let the loaf thaw and rise for about 4-5 hours at room temperature. Bake as directed.
